page.title: 05ENERGY-GAS -WESTFIELD POINT
page.content:
{WESTFIELD POINT IS AN AREA OF OUR {D-BLOCK.}
It is never easy to find just the right site for a natural gas terminal .The land must be relatively flat and must provide a solid base for the terminal buildings.In addition ,it must be possible to lay a pipeline into the site from the sea and out again on the landward side to connect with the national gas pipeline system. Before seeking permission from the Barrow-Borough Council to build at Rampside.British Gas investigated the site from St.Bees Head in the north to Holyhead in the south,and held discussions with some sixty different organizations.When the construction work is finished only 28 hectares will be occupied(one third of the land).
